revised_title: Experimental Investigation of Torque Produced by Light in Oblique Refraction
tldr: This article describes an experiment conducted to investigate the torque produced by a beam of light when refracted through a glass plate at an oblique angle. The authors designed a cube-shaped apparatus to improve upon previous experiments and found that the observed torque agreed with the theoretical calculations, confirming the existence of a normal pull at both incidence and emergence of the light beam.
